main event: A bright, round, glowing object was observed in the sky over Buffalo, New York on December 6, 1960.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 30 seconds and moved in a westerly direction before descending behind trees.

Another sighting on the same date described a bright, circular object in the sky that appeared to be 20-30 degrees above the horizon and was stationary for 5-10 minutes before slowly fading from view.
The object was estimated to be 3-5 degrees in apparent diameter and emitted a bright, white light that illuminated the surrounding area.
No sound was associated with the object, and no unusual movements or changes in brightness were noted during the observation period.
The object was determined to be a natural atmospheric phenomenon, most likely a meteor or other celestial body, and did not represent a threat to national security.
sighted object: a bright, round, glowing object in the sky
photographs: yes, 4 photos were included in the report
